section.p: Like master hosts, delegate hosts require high-performance local or remote storage. For most deployments, solid-state disk (SSD) devices that are directly attached to the host provide an excellent storage solution, and recommends them.

Storage-area network (SAN) systems are also supported. The overall response times and configuration of a SAN affect the performance and stability of and the application it is managing. recommends using only high-performance SAN systems, and assigning separate logical unit numbers (LUNs) for each mounted path.

In addition to the storage required for its operating system, the typical delegate host only requires storage for Docker data. The characteristics of, and preparation for, this storage area are identical to those of the master host.

For delegate hosts supporting the recommended multi-host configuration, in which the master host is in its own, separate resource pool, two delegate hosts require an additional storage area. The area is used for internal services data, so that the hosts can participate in a ZooKeeper ensemble. The characteristics of, and preparation for, this storage area are identical to those of the master host.
